item.title: MATH31-comparison-tests
item.description: Comparison tests # Idea: Compare one series to another with a known convergence/divergence (geometric, harmonic, p-series, etc). Suppose we have two series \(\sum a_n\) and \(\sum b_n\) with positive terms: If \(a_b < b_n\) for all \(n\) , and \(\sum b_n\) converges, then \(\sum a_n\) also converges. If \(a_b > b_n\) for all \(n\) , and \(\sum b_n\) diverges, then \(\sum a_n\) also diverges.

item.title: MATH31-series
item.description: Series and sequences # What is a series # To evaluate series, first find the partial sum: \[\begin{aligned} \sum_{n=1}^\infty n \\ S_n = 1 + 2 + 3 +\ ...\ + n \end{aligned}\] Find the formula for \(S_n\) $$ S_n= \frac{n(n+1)}{2} $$ Take the limit as \(n \rightarrow \infty\) $$ \lim_{n \rightarrow \infty} \frac{n(n+1)}{2} = \infty $$ Telescoping # These series look like two repeating fractions that end up canceling everything except something from the first term and something from the last.
